description: Team-level offensive strategy, control breakout, and quick breakout options using ONLY NHL 25 choices.

offensive_strategy_modes.label: Defend Lead
notes: Use late in the 3rd when protecting a one-goal lead.
D stays home, less pinching, more dump-and-change.
Expect fewer chances for both teams; focus on safe clears.

offensive_strategy_modes.label: Conservative
notes: Good default when your team is outmatched or on a back-to-back.
Reduces odd-man rushes against.
Use if your D is struggling with gap control.

offensive_strategy_modes.label: Standard
notes: Balanced default for most situations at 5v5.
Use at puck drop and any time the game feels even.
Pairs well with 1-2-2 Red in the neutral zone.

offensive_strategy_modes.label: Aggressive
notes: Use when you’re chasing a goal or have clear momentum.
D activates more, forecheck pressure increases.
Expect more rushes both for and against.

offensive_strategy_modes.label: Full Attack
notes: Emergency setting for late-game comebacks or short bursts.
Everyone joins the rush; huge offensive pressure, big risk.
Use in final minutes when down 1–2 goals, not as a default.

control_breakout_options.label: Strong Side Slant
notes: Safe, simple breakout using the strong-side wall.
Best when protecting a lead or when your D is under heavy forecheck.
Use as your default unless you specifically need more creativity.

control_breakout_options.label: Blue-to-Blue
notes: Spreads the ice and uses D-to-D passes at the blue line.
Good vs static forechecks or slow wingers.
Use when you want to open lanes for stretch plays and trailers.

control_breakout_options.label: 3-High
notes: Three high options to maintain puck control through the middle.
Best with skilled forwards who can handle in traffic.
Use when you want clean, controlled entries over dump-and-chase.

quick_breakout_options.label: Stay Wide
notes: Wingers hold the boards; opens up cross-ice passes.
Use vs teams that collapse to the middle in the NZ.
Good for creating width and lateral movement vs slow D.

quick_breakout_options.label: Leave Zone Early
notes: Forwards fly the zone early to create stretch chances.
High-risk, high-reward — can leave your D exposed.
Use when chasing the game or vs very slow defensemen.

quick_breakout_options.label: Close Support
notes: Forwards stay closer to the puck for short passes.
Best when your breakout is struggling or vs heavy forecheck.
Good default when protecting a lead or calming the game down.
